channel.title: Introducing FediDB - DevTools for ActivityPub
channel.description:
# Introducing FediDB - DevTools for ActivityPub
Hello Everyone!
I am the lead developer of [Pixelfed](https://pixelfed.org) and know how challenging ActivityPub can be to implement.
[FediDB](https://fedidb.org/about) is a suite of tools for AP devs to help make it easier to test and validate your implementation with existing implementations like Mastodon, PeerTube, Pixelfed and Pleroma.
We have 3 main features in development:
- **Request Bin** - HTTP Bin with valid AP Actor to test federation support (HTTP Sig, Verb + Actors and more)
- **Verb Validator** - Validate objects with coverage report for known implementations
- **Signature Checker** - HTTP Signature validation helper
We look forward to adding support for more implementations and working with other projects to shape the direction of this project.
The project is in private beta while we fix bugs, will be open to everyone soon!

I haven’t met anybody yet who got access.

Are you talking about the site?

item.title: Introducing FediDB - DevTools for ActivityPub
item.dc:creator: Sebastian
item.description:
Moved from Querying ActivityPub collections in response to:

Querying ActivityPub collections

I didn’t verify if/how handled, but this is where @dansup’s fedidb.org and @cjs testsuite can be very useful in conformance reporting. We should encourage app devs to run these.

Ehm, fedidb.org ?
Did anyone get access meanwhile?
The repository is an empty laravel app for now, so:
Are you talking about the site? Do you have access?

Read full topic

item.title: Introducing FediDB - DevTools for ActivityPub
item.dc:creator: dansup
item.description:
I have released the source code here and will be opening up https://fedidb.org to everyone in the coming days.

FediDB.org has grown beyond just developer tools, you can browse the network, discover ActivityPub projects or find other community resources!

The more I work on this, the more I realize that I cannot do it alone. This project has a lot of potential and should be stewarded by a community organization once it’s more stable.

Have a nice day

Read full topic

item.title: Introducing FediDB - DevTools for ActivityPub
item.dc:creator: dansup
item.description:
Apologies for the delay, I have been pretty busy lately.

I have been refactoring FediDB so it can be used without an account/registration as that was requested a lot. I hope to release it this weekend along with the source code!

Read full topic

item.title: Introducing FediDB - DevTools for ActivityPub
item.dc:creator: Sebastian
item.description:
In theory, if we would get a confirmation mail, do you know what FediDB would offer ?

I am asking because 3 years ago, I wrote these ActivityPub validation schemas …
They are language independent and there are several validators where you simply could save tests.
Could go on with that …

github.com

redaktor/ActivityPubSchema

An inofficial proposal for ActivityPub - JSON Schemas (draft 07)

Read full topic

item.title: Introducing FediDB - DevTools for ActivityPub
item.dc:creator: Sebastian
item.description:
Update by the EU funding programme for FediDB:

“So we cannot force people to work with other people - especially if
there is conflict between individuals involved that can be inconvenient.

The source code becomes incrementally available for you to use, so you
could set up your own instance.”

I did not know there is a difference after the “selected developer phase” then between “becoming public” and “becoming Open Source”, sorry!

So, let’s wait …

Read full topic

item.title: Introducing FediDB - DevTools for ActivityPub
item.dc:creator: Sebastian
item.description:
Well, I know this. Just Unlike is not in the vocabulary.
This is a project which received big nlnet funding, so I hope, Dan will answer.

Read full topic

item.title: Introducing FediDB - DevTools for ActivityPub
item.dc:creator: grishka
item.description:
They are different things. Unlike is the removal of a like, Undo{Like}. Dislike is a downvote. And, consequently, undislike would be the removal of a dislike, Undo{Dislike}.

Read full topic

item.title: Introducing FediDB - DevTools for ActivityPub
item.dc:creator: Sebastian
item.description:
Sorry, @dansup started this, so is informed about replies anywhere.
Discourse is a SILO software, not federated. So mentioning does the same as answering (?)
Apart from that, Sven applied with another email to FediDB and wrote it in the remarks box …

Read full topic

item.title: Introducing FediDB - DevTools for ActivityPub
item.dc:creator: aschrijver
item.description:
On hindsight Like and Dislike were maybe just two of a wide range of social interactions with some content, that were popular / common at the time. Currently many platforms use a broader range of emotions you can express. For example both Github and LinkedIn using “Reactions”, so maybe e.g. a React activity with either an emoji representing the reaction, or a vocabulary of reaction types would be a good extension.

Other than that, I agree. Unlike should be Undo{Like} (and usually a single button, but I understand if FediDB wants to make it more explicit what you are sending based on UI interactions, but maybe the button label should be ‘Undo Like’ as well then).

PS. No one tagged @dansup here, until now, with the notification email issue you are having… (which is most likely to give email notification)

Read full topic

item.title: Introducing FediDB - DevTools for ActivityPub
item.dc:creator: Sebastian
item.description:
Yes but this single button should be named Dislike which is in fact an ActivityPub Activity!

If people read “Unlike” on the front page (!) of an ActivityPub test suite then it bakes in the heads of users, it “crabs” brains (“crabs” as in “f.”) …

The problem is really again an again:
We are talking about a protocol.
We can debate if Unlike or Dislike is a nicer word (maybe let’s watch Life of Brian in between).
Let us just NOT use the wrong word with the protocol, Pöhse Puben (don’t know french Life of Brian) …

Read full topic

item.title: Introducing FediDB - DevTools for ActivityPub
item.dc:creator: grishka
item.description:
I’d assume you should be able to make custom activities and objects (or even templates for them?) and name them whatever you want. The “+” button suggests that. But, yeah, we’ll never know until we’re able to receive those emails.

Read full topic

item.title: Introducing FediDB - DevTools for ActivityPub
item.dc:creator: how
item.description:
Sebastian:

While I can assume that “Unlike” is probably Undo Like (as specified),

If this was the case I would expect a single button.

Read full topic

item.title: Introducing FediDB - DevTools for ActivityPub
item.dc:creator: Sebastian
item.description:
While waiting for access, thank you and my 2 cents from seeing this image :

While I can assume that “Unlike” is probably Undo Like (as specified),

I can also assume “Photo” is the ActivityPub Image type.

But totally wonder what “Text” or “Poll” means as they do not exist in AP.
“Poll” is probably Question but with “Text” you can either be like Trump and send Note or you can be clever and write Article while also Document could be “Text”…

Could this become conformant?

Read full topic

item.description:
I was wondering the same

Read full topic

item.description:
Hey @dansup, congratulations on launching FediDB. I see that the license is not free, can you explain why? I thought FediDB was a tool to help ActivityPub developers to test their applications. How can that be non-free?
